answerText: Blood Wedding [or Bodas de Sangre][10] Blood Wedding is a work of this Spanish playwright, who described the attempts of sisters Adele and Angustias to win the love of Pepe el Romano in The House of Bernarda Alba.
heading: VCU Closed |2013 | Haverford and Michigan State B | 17 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: A white-faced woodcutter represents the Moon, whose appearance from behind the clouds results in a fatal showdown. For 10 points each: [10] Mother's suspicions toward Leonardo Felix are shown to be justified in this work, in which Felix and the Bridegroom kill each other with the same knife.
